sentences.en: After that, through the rifts in the inky clouds sparkled redder and yet more luminous particles.
sentences.cn: 然后在几条墨蓝色云霞的隙缝里闪出几个更红更亮的小片.

sentences.en: an alarm clock with a luminous dial
As a slowly contracting dwarf the star may remain luminous for billions of years.
sentences.cn: 收缩较慢的白矮星仍会发光几十亿年.

sentences.en: He fixed me with those luminous, empty eyes and his melancholy smile.
sentences.cn: 他笑容忧郁地凝视着我，闪亮的眼睛里空无一物。

sentences.en: Her dark eyes were luminous with the feeling that glowed within.
sentences.cn: 她乌黑的眸子却因心潮起伏而晶莹发亮.

sentences.en: Her large dark eyes were almost luminous.
sentences.cn: 她那双黑色的大眼睛几乎是亮闪闪的。

sentences.en: His prose is simple and luminous and quite popular among ordinary readers.
sentences.cn: 他的散文简明易懂,很受一般读者欢迎.

sentences.en: His prose is simple and luminous.
It was a vast, luminous dream.
sentences.cn: 这是一场光亮夺目, 场面很大的梦.

sentences.en: Most clocks and watches in this shop are in luminous paint.
sentences.cn: 这家商店出售的大多数钟表都涂了发光漆.

sentences.en: Sometimes even a very thin coating of luminous paint has been applied to the wires.
sentences.cn: 有的甚至在线上涂上一层薄薄的荧光漆.

sentences.en: The desert was luminous, starkly beautiful.
sentences.cn: 沙漠里泛着光，有一种荒凉之美。

sentences.en: The eyes grew larger and more luminous.
sentences.cn: 眼睛越来越大,越来越亮.

sentences.en: There are luminous knobs on all the doors in my house.
sentences.cn: 我家所有门上都安有夜光把手.

words.tran_cn: [光][电子] 亮度；[光] 发光性（等于luminosity）；光明
发光体；杰出人物；知识渊博的人

phrases.tran_cn: n. 光通量（单位为流明lumen）

trans.tran_cn: 发光的，明亮的，清楚的，辉赫
